summary: Louis H. Hindle was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He appears in payroll certifications for the months of February, November, and December of 1977. The documents list his name and salary, confirming his employment during that period. The documents do not specify his exact role within the committee.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Louis H. Hindle's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his work is not detailed in these documents, his presence on the payroll indicates his contribution to the committee's efforts.
